body: I am glad the translator didn't change the real interpretation from the author. These lgbt nuts don't realize that referring the newhalf as men is part of the fetish in Japan. It's like "so sexy and feminine with big boobs despite being men". Dad or papa is shemale; brother is newhalf and so on. The moment you refer to him as her, it killed off the fetish and turn off many fans of the fetish. There are many that turned on from newhalf existence a.k.a shemale because they were born as 100% male and they still are. The ideology of transgenderism of western culture doesn't fit this fetish. For example in Thailand, even if a transgender already has grs/srs, they are still male on the Identity card and passport.

The whole thing with saying Akane was a man and calling her by he/him made me uncomfortable.... I mean this is clearly not just a femboy that got confused for a woman, as a little "boy" she wanted to grow up to be a girl and she even worked hard to earn the money for top surgery. I wish all the instances when it was said she was a man were changed for "has a dick" instead. It was a nice and cute doujin. Its weird how its so trans positive and yet so insensitive at the same time

Context is important. Unless they ignore the dialogue, readers will form their opinions on things such as netorare or how trans characters are treated. Readers are free to give their opinions, and that's okay. If you don't actually care then you dont need to respond.

I was going to ponder my sexuality, but then I saw @smatin 's comment, and I realized that he is, in fact, right. We are not here to argue wether or not it's ethical to be trans, wether or not gay people should be hung, or if it's immoral for cousins to be having sex. What matters on this site is fapping and fapping alone.

Japan doesn't have to be sensitive to everyones needs, if so, they wouldn't be popular.

@quadraticanus - yeah. I clicked off of it after that part. Japan has terrible lgbt representation. It’s fetishized and not seen as a real thing. I know femboys exist in hentai and that’s a whole different thing but the author clearly wrote in parts about her having surgery. As a trans-man, i understand it’s necessary to tell someone about your genitals before sex...but after she does it she’s sudden 100% defined by it. Everyone just see her as male now. It broke my heart, honestly. I know it’s not that serious, but i’ve had a crappy day and I’m sensitive rn

I don't know if it's just the translation or if the artist actually made that decision, but it feels a tad insensitive to have the clearly trans-female characters in their works refer to themselves and other people refer to them as "men" all the time. It's a weird dichotomy where the stories are fairly positive towards transgenderism and relationships with people who are, yet they still have them be referred to as "men", idk :/
